001package imagingbook.lib.util;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.lang.reflect.Field;
006import java.net.URI;
007import java.net.URISyntaxException;
008import java.net.URL;
009import java.nio.file.FileSystems;
010import java.nio.file.Files;
011import java.nio.file.Path;
012import java.nio.file.Paths;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Collections;
015import java.util.List;
016import java.util.Objects;
017import java.util.stream.Stream;
018
019import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
020import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
021
022public abstract class ClassUtils {
023        
024        /**
025         * Lists all accessible public fields of the given object and 
026         * returns the result as a string.
027         * @param obj a (non-null) object 
028         * @return a string listing the names and values of the object's fields
029         */
030        public static String listFields(Object obj) {
031                Class<?> clz = obj.getClass();
032                StringBuilder buf = new StringBuilder(clz.getName() + ":\n");
033                Field[] fields = clz.getFields();
034                for (Field f : fields) {
035                        String name = f.getName();
036                        String value = null;
037                        try {
038                                value = f.get(obj).toString();
039                        } catch (IllegalArgumentException | IllegalAccessException e1) {                        }
040                        buf.append(name + ": " + value + "\n");
041                }
042                return buf.toString();
043        }
044        
045        /**
046         * Collects and returns the list of classes defined in the specified package.
047         * The {@link Package} may be obtained from an existing {@link Class} object ({@code clazz}) by
048         * {@code clazz.getPackage()}.
049         * 
050         * @param pkg a {@link Package} instance, e.g., {@code Package.getPackage("imagingbook.lib.ij.overlay")}
051         * @return a list of classes contained in the package
052         */
053        public static List<Class<?>> getClassesInPackage(Package pkg) {
054                return getClassesInPackage(pkg.getName());
055        }
056
057        /**
058         * Collects and returns the list of classes defined in the specified package.
059         * Adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/a/58773271 
060         * 
061         * @param pkgName the full package name, e.g., "imagingbook.lib.ij.overlay"
062         * @return a list of classes contained in the package
063         */
064        public static List<Class<?>> getClassesInPackage(final String pkgName) {
065                System.out.println("pkgName = " + pkgName);
066                final String pkgPath = pkgName.replace('.', '/');
067                System.out.println("pkgPath = " + pkgPath);
068                
069                URL pkgURL = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader().getResource(pkgPath);
070                System.out.println("URL = " + pkgURL);
071                
072                URI pkgURI = null;
073                try {
074                        pkgURI = Objects.requireNonNull(pkgURL.toURI());
075                } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
076                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
077                }
078                System.out.println("URI = " + pkgURI);
079        
080                
081        
082                Path root = null;
083                if (pkgURI.toString().startsWith("jar:")) {
084                        root = FileSystems.getFileSystem(pkgURI).getPath(pkgPath);
085                        if (root == null) {
086                                try {
087                                        root = FileSystems.newFileSystem(pkgURI, Collections.emptyMap()).getPath(pkgPath);
088                                } catch (IOException e) {
089                                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
090                                }
091                        }
092                } else {
093                        root = Paths.get(pkgURI);
094                }
095        
096                final ArrayList<Class<?>> allClasses = new ArrayList<Class<?>>();
097                try (final Stream<Path> allPaths = Files.walk(root)) {
098                        allPaths.filter(Files::isRegularFile).forEach(path -> {
099                                String pathName = path.toString();
100                                //System.out.println("pathName = " + pathName);
101                                if (FileUtils.getFileExtension(pathName).equals("class")) {
102                                        String className = FileUtils.stripFileExtension(pathName);
103                                        System.out.println("className = " + className);
104                                        className = className.replace(File.separatorChar, '.');
105                                        className = className.substring(className.indexOf(pkgName));
106                                        try {           
107                                                allClasses.add(Class.forName(className));
108                                        } catch (final ClassNotFoundException | StringIndexOutOfBoundsException ignored) {
109                                        }
110                                }
111                        });
112                } catch (IOException e) {
113                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());
114                }
115                return allClasses;
116        }
117
118        /**
119         * Returns true if the specified {@link Class} object is a sub-type of
120         * {@link PlugIn} or {@link PlugInFilter}.
121         * 
122         * @param clazz a {@link Class} object
123         * @return true if a plugin type
124         */
125        @Deprecated
126        public static boolean isIjPlugin(Class<?> clazz) {
127                return PlugIn.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz) || PlugInFilter.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz);
128        }
129        
130        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
131
132}
